docs.title: My First
docs.text: This repository is form Github. Use Put README.md can put the repository README.md file in below.

docs.title: Install
docs.text:
1. The Installation of mkDocs 
    $ pip install mkdocs
    After installation, you can getting Started with MkDocs : 
    mkdocs new my-project
cd my-project

docs.title: Deploy on Github pages
docs.text:
1. Add .github/workflows/docs.yml with below code in your repository : docs.yml

    name: docs 
on:
push:
    branches:
    - main
pull_request:
    branches:
    - main

jobs:
deploy:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:

    # # https://github.com/marketplace/actions/deploy-mkdocs
    # - uses: actions/checkout@v1
    # - uses: mhausenblas/mkdocs-deploy-gh-pages@master
    #   env:
    #     GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}

    # https://squidfunk.github.io/mkdocs-material/publishing-your-site/?h=github#with-github-actions
    - uses: actions/checkout@v2
    - uses: actions/setup-python@v2
        with:
        python-version: 3.x
    - run: pip install -U git+https://github.com/mkdocs/mkdocs.git#egg=mkdocs
    - run: pip install mkdocs-material
    - run: mkdocs gh-deploy --force
    - run: mkdocs --version

  2. Push all your documentation on Github

  3. Create the site\ foldfer 

    $ mkdocs build

  4. Site files get deployed to a branch Use the following command : 

    $ mkdocs gh-deploy

MkDocs will build your docs and use the ghp-import tool to commit them to the gh-pages branch and push the gh-pages branch to GitHub. 5. Enable Github Pages Go your repository Github website, and enable Repo by Settings > Pages. In the section Build and deployment, set Source to Deploy from the brance. In the next section Branch, set gh-pages /root and click save.

If you want to modify your file, only use the step 2, 3 and 4.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
• Use pip 
    $　pip install mkdocs-material
  • Set material theme in your mkdocs.yml mkdocs.yml
    theme:
  name: material

docs.title: Put README.md in page directly
docs.text:
Try to put the repository README.md file in below.

  • Enable the Snippets extension in your mkdocs.yml mkdocs.yml
    markdown_extensions:
  - pymdownx.snippets
  • Use the instruction in the your_file.md :

    --8<-- ./README.md --8<--

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
Add the following lines to mkdocs.yml:

mkdocs.yml
markdown_extensions:
  - pymdownx.highlight:
      anchor_linenums: true
      line_spans: __span
      pygments_lang_class: true
  - pymdownx.inlinehilite
  - pymdownx.snippets
  - pymdownx.superfences

docs.title: Code copy button
docs.text:
• Add the following to mkdocs.yml to enable them globally :
mkdocs.yml
theme:
  features:
    - content.code.copy
    - content.code.annotate
